reviews.review_msg: Terrible at responding to emails, never follows the syllabus, changed mark distribution of assignments several times, only received one mark all semester. Would not suggest.

Amazing prof and really opens up students' perspectives and challenges ways of thinking. Participation is a must in the course, but if you try and really get into the thinking it's not a hard class at all. Lectures are great - can ruin your favourite movies tho.

Such an amazing prof! I search for classes of his to take again because he is so passionate.  I find I learn a lot from him even though he is tough.  He expects a lot of participation and well organized responses.  He makes you work for your grade.
Awesome professor. Get ready to read and to be critically engaged  in class. Anytime I see Dr Crawford is teaching a class I take it.

This class was so interesting and Lucas made it helped me to affirm my decision to be in GSWS in my first semester. His lectures did not include power points until the end so it was critical to take notes. This class was one of the best I've taken - his content was engaging and gave interesting perspectives on places I knew.

Lucas is a great prof. He's so funny which makes his lectures fun to go to. I actually looked forward to going to this class. The readings are tough to understand sometimes, so definitely go to lecture because he clears them up and will tell you what to expect on the exams. Midterm was super easy!!

Lucas is an awesome prof. If you're really into gender studies he gives great info,lecture,discussion.  If you're just taking this class for extra credit then he's also good because he makes a point of including everyone even if gender studies is new to you.
Lectures were great and fun. Easy breakdown of papers in powerpoints and lectures, but have to attend to get full experience. Twitter assignment was a joke, though. My TA in this course was terrible.

Lucas is incredible! His courses are creatively structured & well organized. He draws on all different types of mediums to present his ideas. His lectures are always engaging & informative. he's hilarious & has great energy, & is very skilled at contextualizing information. He's personable and friendly. i could sing his praises forever.

Lucas is super passionate about what he teaches, and is ALWAYS open to other people's opinions and encourages discussion. Take really good notes during his lectures because what he says is what's on the exams. Difficult course because it questions a lot of "normal" things, but Lucas makes it interesting and engaging!

Professor Crawford is definitely one of the coolest individuals I have ever met! He is clearly passionate about what he teaches. A lot of group work in this class, which I loved. Our main project was to go into the community and perform an urban intervention. I left this seminar everyday with a new understanding and appreciation for the world.
Dr. Crawford's class was like going to a super smart comedy club except you get to participate, plus it's movies! Hard marker but his grading chart is actually easier than others.
lucas changed my mind about so many things and even though it was hard it was actually fun. if you are close minded or skip a lot of classes take another class. loved the poetry workshop!

lucas is hilarious, caring, brilliant, and super flexible. the course is tough and you can't slide by but if you put in the work it will probably change your outlook on life! he helped me learn how to write... never had a prof put so many comments on my work! encouraging, fun, challenging, recommended.

Lectures were boring, his instructions on the assignment are not clear, way too broad. His grading scale is different from the other profs, lower for grades. Very organized, always changing the details of the assignments without telling the students. Hard to reach, and is not accessible for extra help.

Very nice and uncommon prof! Encouraged us to think differently. Interesting class, though not always related to its title: focus on gender issues, homosexuality and transexualism rather than women issues. Readings were often quite complicated. Psychological and philosophical approach, can be confusing when you don't know much about this.
